com.sorcix.sirc

Class IrcColors

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sorcix.sirc.IrcColors

  • public final class IrcColors
extends Object
    This class provides mIRC color codes to be used when sending messages. However, all known markup is stripped upon receiving, and thus sIRC does not support viewing any incoming markup. It is not planned to change this behavior.

    Note that not all IRC clients are able to receive messages with color codes, and that some IRC servers allow channel operators to block color codes. 

     String ex1 = "This message uses " + IrcColors.BOLD + "bold text" + IrcColors.RESET + " and normal text.";
 String ex2 = IrcColors.COLOR + IrcColors.BLUE + "Colored messages start with the COLOR sign, followed by the color number.";
 String ex3 = IrcColors.COLOR + IrcColors.WHITE + "," + IrcColors.BLACK + "Separate the background
 color by a comma.";

    The mIRC website provides documentation on the color code syntax. "http://www.mirc.com/help/color.txt"

    Author:
    Sorcix

    • Method Detail

      • color

        public static String color(String text,
           int color)
        Helper for adding color to a string. This method simply prefixes given string with the color code, and adds the reset character at the end. Note that this will also remove any other formatting.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to colorize.
        color - The color number to use.
        Returns:
        Colorized text.

      • color

        public static String color(String text,
           int color,
           int background)
        Helper for adding color and background to a string. This method simply prefixes given string with the color code, and adds the reset character at the end. Note that this will also remove any other formatting.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to colorize.
        color - The color number to use.
        background - The color number to use as background color.
        Returns:
        Colorized text.

      • remove

        protected static String remove(String input)
        Removes all color codes and markup from given text.
        Parameters:
        input - Text to clear.
        Returns:
        Given text without markup.
